resources.string: Choose one of the predefined templates and modify it.
When tapped: play sound, increase score, switch look, place somewhere else
When tapped: play sound, reduce score, get bigger, place somewhere else
If the timer reaches zero the game ends.
Sets a new high-score if the current score is greater than the last high-score.
ToDo:Define the correct answer for each level. Allowed values are \'yes\' and \'no\'.
ToDo: Define an end screen per level
ToDo: change to the amount of looks within the figures
Images (includes different looks to odd/or not odd out)
This object holds the looks to odd out
This object holds the looks to odd out
Switch to next round of looks
Sets the position of the looks according to the random variable \'shuffle answers\'. Allowed values are 1, 2 and 3.
Image 2 (add looks with connection to image 3 looks)
This object holds the looks to not odd out
Image 3 (add looks with connection to image 2 looks)
Image 3 (add looks with connection to image 2 looks)
This object holds tge looks to not odd out
Random variable to set the position of the looks
You have 3 seconds to choose a look
ToDo: Set the right amount of questions
ToDo: This variable defines the right answer for the question. Accepted values are 1, 2 or 3.
Switches to the answer look after validating your answer.
The condition checks if all questions have been shown.
ToDo: Set the right scene name if new questions were added
Question template (copy scene BEFORE adding questions)
score gets multiplied every time the jumper is falling down
if the jumper changes its position the clouds are moving
if the jumper changes its position the clouds are moving
Saves the position of the jumper permanently
Defines the movement of the jumper (left right) and the screen borders.
defines the falling of the jumper
sets the jumping power of the jumper
places the pickup and moves it
places the pickup and moves it
game elements - add code and images
pickup to avoid - add your images
You can set a new value for the timer
step 2: add an if then else brick. If the timer is greater than 0 change variable timer by -1
step 1: create a new variable level
step 2: add a forever loop and an if-condition
step 3: if the score reaches a certain amount like 200, 400, 600, 800 or 1000 show this object for 1 second
step 4: change variable level by 1 and repeat
Game instruction - add a new instruction
sets the timer and the score and places it
Defines the timer. If it is 0 the next level starts.
ToDo: You can change the timer to another value
Generate the timer. If it reaches 0 the next scene starts.
game elements - add code and images
ToDo: Change the second number according to the amount of asteroids looks
Extra task: speed up after a certain amount of time and show the level up object.
ToDo: Add the collision detection between the asteriods and the laser beam object the if-clause
ToDo: Change the second number according to the amount of looks
Extra task: speed up after a certain amount of time and show level up object
ToDo: Add the collision detection in the if-clause
ToDo: Add the collision detection in the if-clause
step 1: create a new variable level
step 2: add a forever loop and a if-clause
step 3: if timer reaches a certain amount of time show this object for one second
step 5: speed up the asteroids if the level raises
title - add the title of your book
image box - add your animation and code
ToDo: use the \'Switch to\' brick to make your animation. Don\'t forget to use a \'Wait\' brick between the looks
the force is raising as long as you keep touching the rocket
if you let the rocket go it calculates its acceleration and variable touched becomes false
if both rockets crossed the line you have to calculate the acceleration
if rocket 1 starts moving rocket 2 starts moving too
if rocket 1 touches the finish line variables are set
step 1: add a look and place your rocket
step 2: set two local variables. One to define the mass if the rocket and one for the force
step 3: show both variables in the corresponding labels
step 4: set a new variable acceleration abd calculate the rockets acceleration
step 5: Add a new brick to set the velocity of X to the variable acceleration and multiply with - 1000
ToDo: Add the collision detection in the When-brick between your rocket and the finish line
the force is raising as long as you keep on touching the rocket
rocket 2 has the same acceleration as rocket 1
step 5: Add a new brick to set the velocity of X to the variable acceleration and multiply with 1000
Hands on - control by using inclination
If inclination_y is greater than (>) 50 set motor B+C to -50%% (backward) speed.
If inclination_y is smaller than (<) - 50 set motor B+C to -20%% (backward) speed.
ToDo: Edit formula of the if- brick. Category \'Device\' choose \'inclination_y\' . Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range of the sensor (category \'Logic\').
ToDo: Add a brick. Tap on \'+\', switch to category \'Lego EV3\'. Choose the brick to set both motors\' to 50%% speed.
ToDo: Edit formula of the if- brick. Category \'Device\' choose \'inclination_x\' . Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range of the sensor (category \'Logic\').
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\' ; switch to category \'Lego EV3\'. Choose the brick to set the right motor to speed 50 %%.
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\'; switch to category \'Lego EV3\'. Choose the brick to set the left motor to speed 50 %%.

ToDo: Edit formula of the if- brick. Category \'Device\' choose \'inclination_x\' and \'inclination_y\'. Tap on \'Compute\' to see the values. Define the range of the sensor (category \'Logic\'). Combine both terms with AND
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\'; switch to category \'Lego EV3\'. Choose the brick to stop both motors.
ToDo: Add a brick. Tap on \'+\', switch to category \'EV3 Lego\'. Choose the brick to set both motors\' to 20%% speed.
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\' ; switch to category \'EV3 Lego\'. Choose the brick to set the right motor to speed 20 %%.
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\'; switch to category \'EV3 Lego\'. Choose the brick to set the left motor to speed 20 %%.
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\'; switch to category \'EV3 Lego\'. Choose the brick to stop both motors.

ToDo: Edit formula of the when-brick; category \'Device\' choose \'NXT_ultrasonic\'. Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range (category \'Logic\'). Don\'t remove the second part (AND move = TRUE).
ToD: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\' , category \'EV3 Lego\'. Set the motors speed to move backwards for 5 seconds.
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\', category \'EV3 Lego\'. The robot should turn to the right gorgeous 5 seconds.
ToDo: Edit formula of the when-brick; category \'Device\' choose \'NXT_touch\'. Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range (category \'Logic\'). Don\'t delete that part: AND move = TRUE.
Extra task - create a maze ultrasonic sensor
ToDo: Edit formula of the when-brick; category \'Device\' choose \'infrated\'. Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range (category \'Logic\'). Keep the second part (AND move = true)
ToD: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\' , category \'Lego EV3\'. Set the motors speed to move backwards for 5 seconds.
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\', category \'Lego EV3\'. The robot should turn to the right fir 5 seconds.
ToDo: Edit formula of the when-brick; category \'Device\' choose \'EV3_touch\'. Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range (category \'Logic\'). Don\'t delete that part: AND move = TRUE.
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\', category \'EV3 Lego\'. Choose the brick to stop both motors.
Hands on - control by using inclination
If inclination_y is greater than (>) 50 set motor B+C to -20%% (backward) speed.
If inclination_y is smaller than (<) - 50 set motor B+C to -20%% (backward) speed.
ToDo: Edit formula of the if- brick. Category \'Device\' choose \'inclination_y\' . Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range of the sensor (category \'Logic\').
ToDo: Add a brick. Tap on \'+\', switch to category \'NXT Lego\'. Choose the brick to set both motors\' to 20%% speed.
ToDo: Edit formula of the if- brick. Category \'Device\' choose \'inclination_x\' . Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range of the sensor (category \'Logic\').
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\' ; switch to category \'NXT Lego\'. Choose the brick to set the right motor to speed 20 %%.
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\'; switch to category \'NXT Lego\'. Choose the brick to set the left motor to speed 20 %%.

ToDo: Edit formula of the if- brick. Category \'Device\' choose \'inclination_x\' and \'inclination_y\'. Tap on \'Compute\' to see the values. Define the range of the sensor (category \'Logic\'). Combine both terms with AND
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\'; switch to category \'NXT Lego\'. Choose the brick to stop both motors.
Extra task - create a maze ultrasonic sensor
ToDo: Edit formula of the when-brick; category \'Device\' choose \'NXT_ultrasonic\'. Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range (category \'Logic\').
ToD: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\' , category \'NXT Lego\'. Set the motors speed to move backwards.
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\', category \'NXT Lego\'. The robot should turn to the right.
ToDo: Edit formula of the when-brick; category \'Device\' choose \'NXT_touch\'. Tap on \'Compute\' to see the value. Define the range (category \'Logic\'). Don\'t delete that part: AND move = TRUE.
ToDo: Add a new brick. Tap on \'+\', category \'NXT Lego\'. Choose the brick to stop both motors.
Change the listed settings as you wish or switch to predefined profiles to choose a god to help you with these settings.
Choose a guide to help you with Create@School. Which one fits to you?
This is a beta-version. You can only use it with a predefined school account.
